Posts.Content: Thanks. Off to send a message now
Posts.Title: Younger women Facebook group

Posts.Content: I have searched but can't find the link to join for some reason.
Posts.Title: Younger women Facebook group

Posts.Content: The only page that comes up is the one you can like but can't see anywhere to join. Am I missing something lol
Posts.Title: Younger women Facebook group

Posts.Content: I've been drinking lots of water but also found banana milkshake went down well. It has quite a strong flavour so I could taste it but it's also helping with the heartburn I am suddenly getting in my 2 nd week.
Posts.Title: What to drink?

Posts.Content: Hi all I'm due to go for my 2nd docetaxel this afternoon (chemo 5). After explaining to the oncologist registrar the enormous list of side effects I had on the last cycle ,she discussed with consultant and they have decided to reduce my dose to 75. Has anyone else had this? I was told that it should still be effective in this dose so I hope it is. At the same time I was so relieved as I couldn't bare the thought of another cycle like the last one. Hopefully the side effects will at least be a little easier to cope with, I don't expect them to be gone completely but it will be nice if I can at least function and look after my little one. Hope everyone else is well today. Kelly xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel reduced dose

Posts.Content: Apparently mushrooms are very good for iron. So are liver, dark green veg like cabbage or broccoli and peas. Dark chocolate is also supposed to be good. Avoid drinking tea with meals as there is something in it that stops you absorbing the iron. I was also told that if you eat or drink something that is high in vitamin c with something high in iron it helps your body to absorb it. Hope this helps a little. Good luck for your chemo :-)
Posts.Title: A little Anemic

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies think I'll talk it through with onc if it carries on. X
Posts.Title: Periods on fec-t

Posts.Content: Hi everyone First off sorry if this is a little tmi but just wanted to ask a little advice. I have had my 2nd lot of fec today but before I went I found I had got my period I only got my last one 14 days ago. Before I began chemo mine were anything from between 28-35 days. I was told they would be most likely to stop not that I would get more of them grrr lol. I mentioned it to chemo nurse as I thought they may know a little more about it but she seemed puzzled too. So was just wondering has anyone else had this? If so did it stay like that right through chemo or did they eventually stop or at least longer in between? Hope everyone is well. Thanks for reading.
Posts.Title: Periods on fec-t

Posts.Content: Good luck Hun xxx
Posts.Title: results after mx

Posts.Content: This is how I feel too. Just finished chemo yesterday. Next step for me is surgery and node biopsy so still don't know if it has spread or not. Then I will have radiotherapy. My children are 17, 14, and 2. I am 36. I am triple negative too so I know there is higher risk of recurrence. I just look at my 2 year old and worry that if something happens to me she would not have any memories of me and it just breaks my heart. I guess all we can do is try to stay positive and hope for the best. Not sure I have been any help but just wanted to let you know you're not alone. I think we all feel like this. Hugs Kelly x
Posts.Title: Tears - feeling low

Posts.Content: My husband has been great and comes home and does things if I am feeling tired and my teens muck in too. I must admit the housework only gets the bare essentials done. I feel sad that I don't feel up to doing as much with my little one as I used to but I just keep telling myself I will make it up to her when treatment finishes. Kelly xx
Posts.Title: Tears - feeling low

Posts.Content: Hi I haven't tried fasting so can't really comment on that side of things. Do what works for you. The only thing I would say is that you need to eat a little something with your steroids. I started mine yesterday ready for docetaxel today and on one dose I forgot to eat with it and I felt a bit dizzy and off for the afternoon until I had dinner. Might have been a coincidence but thought I'd mention it just in case. Hope everything goes well for you and the fasting works hugs. Kelly x
Posts.Title: Fasting Before & After Chemo

Posts.Content: I haven't had much nausea with docetaxel had loads with fec. Wish I had heard about fasting before that I would have given it a try. Hope your tax goes well too xx
Posts.Title: Fasting Before & After Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi all My Chemo starts on friday to hopefully shrink my lump. Last friday i was offered to take part in a research trial. However i suffer badly with anxiety (even without cancer) and the side effect list was as long as your arm. These included among other things higher risks of heart problems. This really concerned me as i have a strong family history (grandparent, both parents and 4 siblings) with angina or bad heart problems so i decided against going into the trials and to just have the treatment usually offered. The thing is i have been feeling guilty ever since. I know i have made the right decision for me but i feel like such a bad person for not doing it after all if it wasn't for other people taking risks before i wouldn't be able to have the treatment i am having. Am i a really bad person? I am also starting to feel really anxious again, not so much about treatment but worrying they are too late. I have had quite a few delays in treatment due to having genetic tests and my cancer is grade 3 and around 3cm so just keep thinking it is everywhere and it will be too late to do anything about it. I don't know if it is in the nodes as i wont have biopsy until i have surgery which won't be till at least december. thanks for reading. kelly x
Posts.Title: Am i really awful?

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your reply, it really has helped xx
Posts.Title: Am i really awful?

Posts.Content: I think it's normal for us to worry about it spreading, I know I am a nervous wreck before any appointment. I know I don't really know your situation but try to stay positive that the chemo is doing what it's meant to. You can get through this. I had my first lot of chemo last Friday, I haven't had surgery yet either. Feel free to message if you want a chat xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Terrified of ONC appt tomorrow :(

Posts.Content: I think it's normal for us to worry about it spreading, I know I am a nervous wreck before any appointment. I know I don't really know your situation but try to stay positive that the chemo is doing what it's meant to. You can get through this. I had my first lot of chemo last Friday, I haven't had surgery yet either. Feel free to message if you want a chat xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Terrified of ONC appt tomorrow :(

Posts.Content: I'm actually glad to see this post as I had just come on here to post about something similar. I have just got mine and it has only been 20 days, mine are usually 30-35 days. I guess it must be normal then. I was a little worried something was wrong. I was hoping mine would stop as mine are usually horrible and last anything up to 9 days, just my blooming luck I get to keep them ha ha
Posts.Title: Periods during chemo

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your support. I do still feel guilty but already feel a weight has lifted by declining to take part. None of my family wanted me to take part either and at times I felt very torn about it. However I do still think I have made the right decision as I would have been worrying about my heart for the next ten years that's how long I would have been monitored by them for the trial. Xx
Posts.Title: Am i really awful?

Posts.Content: Hi I finished chemo today but I still have survey and rads to go. I worry all the time too about wether its everywhere or if it will return once treatment has finished and I worry tons about the future, I think it's normal to be honest. I think losing your mum to cancer must have an affect on how you will deal with your cancer. My dad has terminal lung cancer that has spread to lots of places and I know this has made me much more paranoid about me having it everywhere. I wish I could help more Kelly xxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling paranoid, dare I think of a future

Posts.Content: That's fantastic news I'm really pleased for you :-) hugs Kelly xx
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Hi I had my first lot of fec 11 days ago and today I think my hair has started to drop quite a bit so think I will take the bull by the horns and shave it within the next couple of days. I bought a few bandanas and scarves off of Anna bandana they are quite reasonably priced and fitted so you don't have to worry about tying them. Hope everything goes well. Xxxx
Posts.Title: FEC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Thanks kate I think I will try chatting to the nurses. One part of me wants to say no because some of the possible side effects are heart issues and there is a family history of heart problems. But I feel selfish if I say no because it's important to test these new things isn't it.
Posts.Title: Chemo,trials, lumps and coil pin thingy's

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. Went back for another appointment yesterday this time with oncologists. I will be starting fec-t within a week or 2. They did another ultrasound to check size and the lump seems bigger I don't know if they seemed worried by this or not as they tend to talk among themselves a bit but I guess they know what they're doing. They mentioned about putting a coil or pin into the lump after I have had my first 3 lots of chemo. Does anyone have any experience of this? How exactly do they do it and is it uncomfortable? Also they have asked if I want to take part in a clinical trial. It would mean another short delay in treatment and risk of more side effects so not sure which way to go on this and obviously don't have long to decide. I would be interested if anyone else has been offered as to wether you did it or not and why if that's not too nosey lol Thanks for reading hoping everyone is having a good day Kelly x
Posts.Title: Chemo,trials, lumps and coil pin thingy's

Posts.Content: Thanks again everyone for your replies they really have helped. Today I am trying to be more positive and trying just to keep everything as normal as I can. Hopefully I will hear something about my surgery soon. Kelly xxxx
Posts.Title: I'm new and just been diagnosed.

Posts.Content: I have an appointment on Wednesday for a chat and to see what happens next.
Posts.Title: I'm new and just been diagnosed.

Posts.Content: Thankyou all so much for your replies it has helped and i am feeling a bit more positive. I'm going to try and take it a day at a time and try not to get so pulled down with negative thoughts. My husband and friends are great and a couple of my sisters are ﻿very supportive. It's good to know i'm not alone although i hate that there is so many of you going through it. Thanks for your help kelly
Posts.Title: I'm new and just been diagnosed.

Posts.Content: Hi I hope i am posting this in the right place.  Tuesday i went to find out my biopsy results and found out that i have breast cancer. I don't know exactly what is going on yet. I know the lump is about 2cm and that i have to have an op and chemo. I went back today for a microbubbles (not sure if this is the right word) test to see if there are cells in the glands under my arm but the bubbles wouldn't go to the right place and the biopsy couldn't be taken. I don't really know what happens next my head is in a bit of a whirl as you can imagine. I didn't think i would be facing this yet as i am only 36. I am more worried for my children who are 16, 13 and just 20 months. I am so worried that i won't be around for them growing up especially my youngest as if something happened to me she wouldn't even remember me. I'm sorry i am being so morbid but i can't really discuss these feelings with my family as they get too upset. It hasn't helped that also on tuesday my dad found out that his lung cancer that has returned is incurable so of course i am also worried for my dad but also it has got me thinking again about my cancer spreading.  Tuesday  i felt really calm but now i am really emotional and just can't seem to stop crying especially when i look at my little one, is this normal? I would really appreciate any tips or advice on how to stay strong and get through this. Thanks for reading kelly
Posts.Title: I'm new and just been diagnosed.

Posts.Content: Thankyou all for your replies they have helped. I spoke to my bc nurse today and I explained how I have been feeling and she has tried her best to reassure me. I am seeing the surgeons the week after next so hopefully won't have too long to Wait for op. thanks again Kelly xx
Posts.Title: Is it normal to be feeling like this?

Posts.Content: Thanks Patricia its nice to know you're not alone in all this. I'm not feeling too bad at mo. I had my last chemo today and usually feel most anxious and down the week after so I'm prepared for that. Surgery next and node biopsy hopefully they will be clear and won't need more ops. Then rads. Thanks again for your lovely reply Kelly xx
Posts.Title: Is it normal to be feeling like this?

Posts.Content: I have just sold my baby cot as my little one has grown out of it. I wasn't prepared for how that would feel and I sobbed for a good ten minutes and still feel tearful now. I think it has really just hit me that there will be no more babies and that I have no choice in the matter. I know I am luckier than some as I already have my lovely kids and I do apologise if I am being insensitive I really don't mean to be. Did anyone else feel like this after chemo. I just always thought I'd have one more and didn't feel quite finished if that makes sense. Thanks for reading Kelly xxxx
Posts.Title: Just hit me that there will be no more babies.

Posts.Content: Hi all firstly let me apologise for asking for yet more advice/help,I feel like I take much more than I give on here sometimes. I have been feeling very anxious the last few days. I am convinced that my cancer has just spread everywhere and that the docs are going to tell me they can't do anything. I keep getting aches in my stomach and I have had bleeding piles (tmi so sorry) for quite a while. Also on the back of my neck I kept saying to my hubby (before I knew I had cancer) that there was a bulge it felt like the muscle, well since being on chemo it feels to me like it is smaller. So I have convinced myself all these things are where my cancer has spread. My dad has terminal lung cancer his has spread like that so I don't know if this is why I am feeling this way. I was diagnosed in June with grade 3 triple negative ( i know this is more aggressive)ducal invasive carcinoma (?). As yet I still don't know if its in the nodes and the uncertainty is really starting to get to me. I'm so scared I just can't stop crying. I keep thinking about my children and my husband and what will happen if I'm not here. I have been seeing the oncology counsellor but not sure how helpful it is at the moment. Any advice would be truly appreciated. Thanks in advance Kelly xx
Posts.Title: Is it normal to be feeling like this?

Posts.Content: Hi all. Yesterday, I went to see surgeon to find out the results from lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy. The good news is that the chemo had done its job and the Tumor had shrunk to 10mm from 11/2 inch. There was a little dcis? But even with that it only measured 15mm. The lump was removed,with clear margins, so no more surgery needed there, which is good. However, one of the two lymph nodes removed had cancer in. I have to have axillary clearance next week. I now feel like I am back to square one, waiting again and still no wiser after 6 months of being diagnosed. I had been feeling really good and positive since surgery but now,the doubts are creeping in again. I can't help thinking about the bump I used to be able to feel on my neck before I had chemo but can't feel now. Or the pains I get in my stomach and bleeding piles ( sorry tmi but I am now thinking it is cancer instead of piles). I also keep worrying about dizzy spells and breathlessness I keep getting. I am convinced again that all the nodes will be positive and there will be tumours everywhere. I keep looking back to before my little one was born over 2 years ago. I remember thinking back then that one of my breasts looked a bit bigger but i didnt think anything of it, i thought everyone had one bigger than the other and it just noticed more becaused i had gained weight. it never occurred to me that it could be cancer. I just keep thinking i already had it back then. My cancer is grade 3,triple negative, so it's aggressive and I just keep thinking if I did have it back then, it must have spread in that time. It isn't helping that my dad has terminal lung cancer that has spread, so I am worrying about him but also his cancer spreading has made me worry even more about mine. I just can't seem to imagine myself ever getting better and have an awful gut feeling that I am in for more bad news. I really want to get back to my happy positive self from the past couple of weeks. People just keep telling me to be positive and enjoy Christmas. I really do want to but I don't know how to shut these thoughts out or deal with them. Sorry this is so long and whiney, I just really need to get this off my chest. I really wish they would do a ct and bone scan but they won't unless there is over a certain amount of nodes affected. This not knowing where I am is really starting to get to me after 6 months. I'm sorry it's all bunched up, for some reason my paragraphs don't work on here.
Posts.Title: Not great news

Posts.Content: Hi Thankyou so much for your reply, it has really helped. I am trying to take your advice and will try not to over think things(something I'm very guilty of). I am going to enjoy Christmas. How do you space you paragraphs on here, it doesn't seem to matter how I write my posts, everything is lumped into one big paragraph when I publish it. X
Posts.Title: Not great news

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy I had fec-t 3 of each. I think I am just fed up with waiting for answers. I was diagnosed back in June and still don't know the stage of my cancer. As soon as I think I am going to get answers the goalposts get moved. I have seen a lot of people on here that know everything there s to know about their cancer within weeks. I just don't understand why they have to keep me hanging all the time. Sorry I'm just having a really bad day. X
Posts.Title: Not great news

Posts.Content: Had my last chemo (I hope) this morning and just want to say yipeeeeeee. Just surgery and rads to go. Hopefully that will be it :-). Hope everyone is well Kelly xxx
Posts.Title: Last chemo
